At that time, there was a monk named Shizi who wanted to eat sugar. The Buddha said:

Unconsolidated karmas and consolidated karmas.
What are unconsolidated karmas?

It means when the monks are performing karmas within the same boundary, if the assembly is not complete, those who have consent do not give consent, although they all gather, those who should object object and do not stop, and the karma is forcefully performed. What are consolidated karmas?

It means when the monks are performing karmas within the same boundary, they all come and gather together, those who have consent give consent, those who should object object, and when they object, they stop. This is called a consolidated karma.
